parameters.definition: Number of apples in a banana-haters package
Number of grapes in a banana-haters package
Number of apples in a combo package
Number of bananas in a combo package
Number of grapes in a combo package

description: A grocery store wants to liquidate its stock of \param{ApplesStock} apples, \param{BananasStock} bananas, and \param{GrapesStock} grapes. Given past experience, the store knows that they can propose a banana-haters package with \param{ApplesBHPack} apples and \param{GrapesBHPack} grapes and that this package will bring a profit of \param{ProfitBHPack} euros. Similarly, they can prepare a combo package with \param{ApplesCombo} apples, \param{BananasCombo} bananas, and \param{GrapesCombo} grapes, yielding a profit of \param{ProfitCombo} euros. They know they can sell any quantity of these two packages within the availability of its stock. What quantity of each package, banana-haters packages and combo packages, should the store prepare to maximize net profit?
